bug.author: jmarrr
bug.description:

comments.comment: I have the same issue with mesa 18.2.8 drivers(Works on 0.9.2). With the latest amdgpu-pro drivers(18.40) CARLA runs fine but the textures are mainly black/missing.
Exact the same issue for me, same errors but on Ubuntu 18.04LTS.
Having the same issue on Ubuntu 18.04LTS.
hey guys, its seems the problem came from graphic drivers, i recently bought 1050ti and install gpu drivers then the problem is gone. This error might happen without gpu

I thought so. But I already had the drivers installed. The issues was that I didn't restarted my pc after I installed. Silly, right? Haha. Anyway, I have a GF830M in my notebook using the driver 410.78 for Linux. Thanks for the tip @overlapjho !

Hey, I got same problem and solved. My problem is without execute <denchmark-link:https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/NVIDIA_Optimus>Nvidia Optimus</denchmark-link> . If you using carla on laptop, execute with It work on me. Asus UX410UQ. Geforce 940MX. nonfree driver. Manjaro linux 4.20.3-1

If someone could comment or update this with a proper workaround, that would be awesome. On 2 different machines I tried updating the drivers and rebooting after installation, but to no avail. both systems are Ubuntu 16.04 One has a radeon amd gpu and the other has a stock intel.

<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46110602/54519962-9089f280-49a2-11e9-88ce-77989c0caa39.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46110602/54520013-a8fa0d00-49a2-11e9-910d-9e907f70580c.png></denchmark-link>
I face the same problem......does anyone know what happened...I am going to be crazy
Same issue on Ubuntu 16.04.6 with 1080 Ti (driver version: 418.43). I am running CARLA 0.9.4.
Maybe you haven't got the OpenGL library? Try sudo apt-get install freeglut3-dev mesa-utils

Hi, Anybody with that problem? I have checked a bit and seems the problem could be using the flag -opengl3 in the command line. It seems that Unreal Engine for Linux can not use that version, and then shaders can not compile and program can not link properly. So, try the command line without that flag and see again, for example with: ./CarlaUE4.sh Game/Carla/Maps/Town01 -benchmark -fps=10 Regards
Hi, It happens using the opengl3 parameter? Can you give me some more details about how to try to reproduce that problem?

on my laptop I also observing this issue with official carla v0.9.5 release: <denchmark-code>[2019.06.11-09.31.59:118][ 0]LogRHI: Error: Failed to link program. Current total programs: 134 binary bytes: 409286582 log: error: vertex shader output `out_TEXCOORD0' specifies noperspective interpolation qualifier, but fragment shader input specifies no interpolation qualifier
Failed to find symbol file, expected location: "/tmp/carla-20190400-095-original/CarlaUE4/Binaries/Linux/CarlaUE4.sym" Fatal error: [File:/var/lib/jenkins/UnrealEngine_4.21/Engine/Source/Runtime/OpenGLDrv/Private/OpenGLShaders.cpp] [Line: 3718] Failed to link program. Current total programs: 134, precompile: 0 Signal 11 caught. Malloc Size=65538 LargeMemoryPoolOffset=65554 CommonUnixCrashHandler: Signal=11 Malloc Size=65535 LargeMemoryPoolOffset=131119 Malloc Size=68112 LargeMemoryPoolOffset=199248 Malloc Size=128368 LargeMemoryPoolOffset=327632 Malloc Size=501903 LargeMemoryPoolOffset=829551 Engine crash handling finished; re-raising signal 11 for the default handler. Good bye. Segmentation fault (core dumped) </denchmark-code>

OpenGL version string: 3.0 Mesa 18.0.5 OpenGL shading language version string: 1.30 OpenGL context flags: (none)
